Omics Pipeline

Rapid, scalable, affordable, managed enterprise-class Omics pipelining on HPC/Cloud as a managed service

Introduction

R&D Teams in BioPharma have a critical dependency on timely availability of high-quality data. Satisfying this need has become quite challenging even for large BioPharma as the volume of data to process is increasing exponentially with availability of data in open and restricted ways, Sequencing innovation, Transition from single to pan genome reference and Innovations in single cell and spatial transcriptomics.

While several platforms exist to address the needs of Omics data analysis, proprietary platforms are expensive for every-day R&D use, and open-source platforms require a lot of expertise to be deployed for industrial use.

Our Solution

An enterprise-class Omics pipelining platform on HPC/Cloud, with Pre-packaged service offering for rollout and managed services for continuous use armed with:

  • Aganitha Omics Kube (AOK) on AWS/GCP/Azure/HPC
  • Open-source state-of-art platforms for Omics pipelines from Broad Institute
  • ntegrated with Illumina BaseSpace, PacBio SMRT Link, 10x Genomics Cell Ranger, Trans-Proteomic Pipeline from Institute for Systems Biology (Seattle)
  • APIs for integration with ELNs such as Benchling

SCALABLE PROCESSING POWER

Proven to scale well for processing vast data sets such as UK BioBank 500k WES dataset

CROSS FUNCTION COMPATIBLE

Vertically integrated and optimized solution, providing best-in-class performance

Modifiable-off-the-shelf

Pre-packaged service offering (PSO) for platform rollout along-side a full catalog of service offerings

Open-source tech & API integration-

Based on best-in-class open-source technologies (like Hail and Cromwell) and has APIs for integration with Benchling (ELN)

Cloud & Scheduler compatible

Compatible with cloud providers (AWS/GCP/Azure/HPC) supporting Kubernetes, and classic HPC schedulers

Integrated with sequencing solutions

Integrated with Illumina BaseSpace, PacBio SMRT Link, 10x Genomics Cell Ranger, Trans-Proteomic Pipeline from Institute for Systems Biology (Seattle)

Benefits/Outcomes

  • Reduction in turn-around time from months to weeks and day for both internal and external analysis
  • Reduction in cost per analysis and total cost of ownership
  • Higher productivity of R&D teams armed by comprehensive and timely availability of data
  • One-stop solution for Omics analysis, e.g., GWAS, differential expression analysis, protein/metabolite identification etc.
  • Inexpensive, scalable, and easy to use platform to ensure quick user adoption
